metadata.title: CVE-2017-16647 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
drivers/net/usb/asix_devices.c in the Linux kernel through 4.13.11 allowslocal users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference andsystem crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted USBdevice.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-16647` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.13.0-38-generic - 4.13.0-38.43~16.04.1
linux-image-4.13.0-38-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-38.43~16.04.1
linux-image-4.13.0-38-lowlatency - 4.13.0-38.43~16.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-38-generic - 4.13.0-38.43~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1014-azure - 4.13.0-1014.17
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-1014-azure - 4.13.0-1014.17
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1012-gcp - 4.13.0-1012.16
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-1012-gcp - 4.13.0-1012.16
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1022-oem - 4.13.0-1022.24
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-38.43~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1014.17').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1012.16').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-oem package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1022.24').
